p.caps_html_text_node: Enables the KMDF verifier on the test computer. The choices are
. If the KMDF verifier is not enabled, basic framework verification is enabled as part of
if KMDF version is 1.9 or higher.

td.p: Specifies the service names of the KDMF drivers to monitor.
Enables IRQL checks and critical memory leak checks.
Enables checks created after the current driver version.
Specifies options for testing forward progress handling of your driver.

p.caps_html_text_node: No faults will be simulated to test the forward progress handling of your driver.
All I/O requests destined for a forward progress queue will appear to fail, relying on your driver's forward progress handling.
Randomly fail I/O requests destined for a forward progress queue.

td.p: Specifies the list of object handle types to track.
Enables KMDF loader messages through the debugger. A reboot of the target computer is required to enable this.

Starting with Windows Vista, the operating system suppresses DbgPrint output by default, which makes the WDF Loader diagnostic messages unusable until the suppression is overridden. KDMF Verifier can manage this for you so that KMDF loader diagnostics are available in the kernel debugger for these systems.

p.caps_html_text_node: Specifies the number of non-paged pool pages (1-10) to allocate for kernel event trace logs. The options are
, the number of pages depends on the KMDF runtime. Starting with KMDF 1.9, the runtime uses more pages when verification is enabled with verbose logging.

td.p: Specifies the number of successful memory allocations allowed before the KMDF verifier starts to fail all memory allocations.
